TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE . They are father and son .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants and friends of theirs were holidaying beside a lake near GPE . In turns , members of the group were riding a jetboat . On several occasions some of them rode close to a sports centre on the opposite shore .

CARDINAL . NORP Some time later , unexpectedly , CARDINAL cars without licence plates arrived at the lakeside location where the applicants ' group was situated . CARDINAL men wearing camouflage uniforms got out of the cars , some of them wore vests with “ Police ” written on the back . The men were armed with sub - machine guns . They started insulting the applicants and their friends and threatening them , both verbally and by pointing their guns at them . The men made the applicants and their friends lie flat on the ground and then hit and kicked them repeatedly . The beating continued for TIME . At the same time , the men repeatedly shot at the applicants ' jetboat . After that they left .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant was examined by doctors who established that he had CARDINAL broken ribs , a superficial wound on his left temple and several bruises on his face , back and legs . The second applicant suffered bruises on his face , head and right leg .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants complained to the prosecution authorities . On CARDINAL and DATE the first applicant lodged additional submissions , stating that he and his son were being followed and that he had been threatened in an attempt to induce him to withdraw his complaints .

CARDINAL . The prosecution authorities opened criminal proceedings in relation to the beating and , on unspecified dates , brought charges against QUANTITY police officers working in ORG , a specialised unit of ORG . It was established that , at the relevant time , the accused had been dispatched to the area where the beating had taken place , with the task of guarding a Ministry of the Interior training centre and a forest reserve .

CARDINAL . NORP The prosecution authorities collected witness testimonies from the applicants and their friends , as well as from other witnesses , including eyewitnesses to the beating . They commissioned a ballistic expert and carried out confrontations and identity parades .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicants were admitted as civil claimants in the criminal proceedings .
CARDINAL . Up to DATE the investigation had not resulted in indictments against the accused .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date after DATE the accused , relying on a new LAW , Article CARDINAL ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , requested that their case be brought to court or terminated .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE or DATE the prosecution indicted the QUANTITY police officers for causing bodily harm and for disorderly conduct .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG remitted the case , finding that the prosecution authorities had committed procedural violations . In particular , it found that : CARDINAL ) it was not clear from the indictment whether the accused had been armed with sub - machine or automatic guns during the attack against the applicants ; CARDINAL ) the indictment had been based on insufficient evidence , and , in particular , on no material evidence ; CARDINAL ) CARDINAL of the witnesses had been examined superficially ; and CARDINAL ) the prosecution had failed to comment on exonerating witness testimony .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecution filed a revised indictment against the police officers .

CARDINAL . In a decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG established that the procedural violations found earlier had not been remedied . In addition , new deficiencies were identified : CARDINAL ) the prosecution had not commented on the possibility of bringing charges for the verbal threats ; CARDINAL ) the date of the record of the examination of a witness had been amended , but this had not been certified by a valid signature of the witness ; and CARDINAL ) the records showing that the accused had been notified of the results of the investigation had been printed out on a printer but the respective dates and hours had been added on a typewriter ; again , this additional information had not been certified by the accused 's signatures .

CARDINAL . Concluding that the deficiencies thus identified amounted to material procedural breaches within the meaning of Article CARDINALa of the Code of Criminal Procedure ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , ORG terminated the criminal proceedings .

CARDINAL . The applicants and the prosecution authorities appealed against this decision arguing that ORG had erred in concluding that the prosecution authorities had committed material procedural breaches . On DATE those appeals were rejected by ORG because decisions under LAW were not subject to appeal .

CARDINAL . NORP Apparently , some internal inquiry into the officers ' conduct was carried out by ORG , but the ORG has not been informed of its course and findings . No disciplinary punishments were ever imposed on the police officers allegedly involved in the beating .

CARDINAL . Articles CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Criminal Code make it an offence to cause a light , intermediate or severe bodily injury to another person . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) provides that if the injury is caused by a police officer in the course of , or in connection with , the performance of his or her duties , the offence is an aggravated one . This offence is a publicly prosecutable one .

CARDINAL . Persons claiming that they have been beaten by police officers can seek damages under LAW DATE . The remedy has been described in more detail in the ORG 's judgment in the case of NORP v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the new Article CARDINALa of the Code of Criminal Procedure CARDINAL , in force at the relevant time , introduced the possibility for an accused person to request to have his case examined by a court if the preliminary investigation has not been completed within the statutory time - limit ( DATE for investigations concerning serious crimes and DATE for all other investigations ) . In such instances , the courts would send the case to the relevant public prosecutor 's office with instructions to either enter an indictment against the accused within DATE or discontinue the criminal proceedings . If the prosecutor 's office failed to take action , or if the case was remitted for material procedural breaches , which were not remedied within a new time - limit of DATE , the courts would terminate the criminal proceedings themselves . The alleged victims could not participate in the proceedings under Article CARDINALa of the Code of Criminal Procedure .

CARDINAL . NORP Under domestic law , as it stood at the relevant time , victims of crimes could only participate in pre - trial proceedings as civil claimants . In this capacity they could acquaint themselves with the case file , present evidence , make requests and appeal against acts of the courts to the extent that this was related to their civil claim .
